studentLoans.name: Interest-Free Student Loan Scheme
studentLoans.provider: Ministry of Higher Education and Vocational Education (Sri Lanka)
studentLoans.maxAmount: Depends on degree length & stream (e.g., up to Rs. 1,500,000 for 4-year Engineering; stipend loan up to Rs. 300,000 optional)
studentLoans.duration: Total loan period 12 years; grace period 1 year; repayment over 7 or 8 years (84 or 96 instalments) after completing degree
eligibility: Sat for G.C.E. (A/L) in 2022, 2023, or 2024 and eligible for university admission
3 simple (S) passes for all 3 subjects in the same sitting (max 3 sittings)
Common General Test: minimum 30 marks (max 3 sittings)
General English: at least simple (S) pass at A/L OR English Language: at least simple (S) pass at O/L
features: Covers approved degree programmes at affiliated Degree Awarding Institutes (DAIs)
Optional stipend loan up to Rs. 300,000 for daily expenses
Repayment starts after degree completion + 1-year grace period
Maximum loan limits vary by stream and whether degree is 3-year or 4-year

studentLoans.name: Commercial Bank Educational Loans
studentLoans.maxAmount: Up to Rs. 10,000,000 (covers up to 75% of total course fee, including examination charges)
eligibility: Applicant must be at least 18 years old
Employed: minimum monthly net salary Rs. 75,000
Self-employed professionals: must be qualified in their field
features: Covers up to 75% of total course fee (incl. exam charges)
Repayment options: equated monthly instalments or reducing balance instalment method
Documents required: application, recent salary slips, employer confirmation letter, bank statements

studentLoans.name: Bank of Ceylon Educational Loan
eligibility: Minimum 3 passes at G.C.E. (A/L) for degree courses (as stated in document)
features: Financial assistance for higher education (general description in document)

studentLoans.name: Wisdom Loan Scheme
features: Focus: supporting youth to achieve educational goals (as stated in document)
